availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Eli W. Fairchild (Johnson County and Magoffin County, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky and Magoffin County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Malissa Fairchild. Father of Nancy J. Fairchild, David M. Fairchild, Cynthia E. Fairchild, Clarinda F. Fairchild, Mary Ann Fairchild, and Amanda B. Fairchild. Farmer in Johnson County in 1850. Farmer in Magoffin County in 1860. Private in the 65th Regiment of Kentucky Militia (U.S.A.) from May 21, 1864, to June 21, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 124B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Magoffin County, p. 25.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, Paintsville Precinct, p. 8.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 894.
